title: Momentum - change in momentum during collision

content.prompt: Which of the following provides a correct prediction about the change in the momentum of the two-block system with correct justification?

choices.label: The change in momentum of the system is negative because kinetic energy is lost in the collision.
The change in momentum of the system is negative because the blocks have a speed less than v0 after the collision.
The change in momentum of the system is zero because there is no net external force exerted on the system.
The change in momentum of the system is zero because the kinetic energy of the system is constant during the collision.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
